pecking order.translation[0].definitions: a social system within a group of people or animals in which each member knows who has a higher or lower rank than themselves
Nobody wants to be at the bottom of the pecking order.
pecking order.translation[1].definitions: the way that people or companies are ranked according to how important, successful etc they are
The IMF ranking is used to measure the pecking order of the worldâ€™s leading economic powers.
Bonuses make it hard to tell exactly where directors stand in the corporate pecking order.
